info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:38PM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
At 538 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elloree, or 15 miles east of Brookdale. This storm was nearly stationary.
...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor...
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 to 50 mph and torrential rainfall.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Brookdale, Bowman, Elloree, Santee State Park, Santee, Cameron, Vance, Poplar Creek Landing, Stumphole Landing, Yonder Field, Indian Bluff Recreation Park, Creston, Mill Creek Marina and Campground, Low Falls Landing, Lone Star, and Wilkinson Heights.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 144 and 165. Interstate 95 between mile markers 90 and 102.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

parameter.value: A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, southwestern Clarendon and northeastern Orangeburg Counties through 630 PM EDT

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Clarendon; Central Orangeburg; Southeastern Orangeburg
